content.description: Crack/seam on right side of wall.  Good pro for a beginner leader.
content.protection: Standard rack anchors are higher up than any others on the wall
content.location: The One Day Wall is located way up on the right side of the Chessmen.  Hike around the right side of the Knight then up slabs staying left until you hit the upper walls.  Work right until a notch will allow you to go up and over the ridge.  The route is the fifth one from the left.

The One Day Wall is located way up on the right side of the Chessmen.  Hike around the right side of the Knight then up slabs staying left until you hit the upper walls.  Work right until a notch will allow you to go up and over the ridge.  The route is on the tower to the right.

climbs.name: No One Saw That, Right?
climbs.fa: Jon Ruland, John Hinrichsen, Eric Ruljancich,'10

content.description: Fun corner/crack system with good pro gear and one bolt near the top.
content.location: The One Day Wall is located way up on the right side of the Chessmen.  Hike around the right side of the Knight then up slabs staying left until you hit the upper walls.  Work right until a notch will allow you to go up and over the ridge.  The route is the first one on the left.

content.description: Face climbing from the toe of the tower up to the right block at the top.
content.location: The One Day Wall is located way up on the right side of the Chessmen.  Hike around the right side of the Knight then up slabs staying left until you hit the upper walls.  Work right until a notch will allow you to go up and over the ridge.  The route is the right hand of the two on the tower.

climbs.name: Day of Drilling Dangerously
climbs.fa: Jon Ruland, John Hinrichsen, Eric Ruljancich,'10

content.description: Low angle arete and buttress on the left side of the One Day Wall.  Jon's first ground up FA.
content.location: The One Day Wall is located way up on the right side of the Chessmen.  Hike around the right side of the Knight then up slabs staying left until you hit the upper walls.  Work right until a notch will allow you to go up and over the ridge.  The route is the first one on the left.

content.description: Pretty sustained all the way.  Finishes left of the anchors.  A 10+ 2 bolt finish goes right then over the bulge and has separate anchors.
content.location: The One Day Wall is located way up on the right side of the Chessmen.  Hike around the right side of the Knight then up slabs staying left until you hit the upper walls.  Work right until a notch will allow you to go up and over the ridge.  The route is the third one from the left.

content.description: Low angle face to right side of ledge then it steepens and has a fun finishing bulge.
content.location: The One Day Wall is located way up on the right side of the Chessmen.  Hike around the right side of the Knight then up slabs staying left until you hit the upper walls.  Work right until a notch will allow you to go up and over the ridge.  The route is the fourth one from the left.

content.description: The One Day Wall was prepped, equipped, and climbed in a single day: May 30, 2010. The wall has a WSW aspect providing morning shade.
